title: Formal vs Simulation â€” prove mutual exclusion for grants
description: Explain when you'd use formal vs simulation and write an SVA property that asserts mutual exclusion for grant1 and grant2.

examples.output: Formal finds violations where both grant1 and grant2 are asserted simultaneously.
examples.explanation: Formal is excellent for exhaustive corner-case proof.

constraints: Formal checks typically require a reset and stable environment constraints for soundness.
hints: Explain Bounded Model Checking (BMC) vs induction.
Use formal assumptions to restrict environment.

solution.code:
property p_mutual_excl; @(posedge clk) !(grant1 && grant2); endproperty
assert property (p_mutual_excl) else $error("Mutual exclusion violated");
